availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Grayson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Matilda Salsman. Father of Sarah A. Salsman, John Salsman, Andrew Salsman, James Salsman, Nancy Salsman, Levina Salsman, Squire Salsman, Rebecca E. Salsman, Martha Salsman, and Thomas L. Salsman. Farmer in Grayson County in 1850 and 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, p. 20. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, p. 11. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, Precinct 5, p. 26. Find A Grave, "Lot Salsman (1809-1876)," Memorial #69259893, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=69259893&ref=acom (accessed June 26, 2017).
